Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route - India Today
summary:
Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route

Published On: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: India Today

Ispace, a Tokyo-based lunar exploration company, has announced its second lunar mission targeting a soft landing on the Moon's Sea of Cold.

  • The six-day launch window opens in mid-January 2025.
  • The mission will deploy a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.
  • The lunar lander will take several months to reach the Moon using a low-energy trajectory.
  • Mission 2 aims to execute a lunar flyby and soft landing, utilizing backup sites for mission flexibility.
“Mission 2 represents our continued commitment to the lunar economy,” said Takeshi Hakamada, Founder & CEO of ispace.

This mission underlines the synergy between private space companies and international agencies, enhancing the development of a robust lunar economy.
newTitle: Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route

title: NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth On THIS Date, Check Time, Speed And Distance - Times Now
summary:
NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Times Now

NASA is keeping a close watch on two house-sized asteroids, 2024 XQ4 and 2024 XN15, which will make their closest approaches to Earth on December 21, 2024. NASA confirms that they pose no threat to our planet.

  • Asteroid 2024 XQ4 has a diameter of 50 feet and will pass within 1,060,000 kilometers of Earth at 47,634 km/h at 3:03 PM IST.
  • Asteroid 2024 XN15 is approximately 60 feet in diameter, passing at a distance of 3,780,000 kilometers at 35,051 km/h, closest at 2:38 PM IST.
  • Both asteroids do not classify as Potentially Hazardous Objects according to NASA's criteria.
  • NASA utilizes a network of telescopes for tracking Near-Earth Objects to assess their trajectories and risks.
“Neither of these asteroids classifies as a Potentially Hazardous Object (PHO).”

This monitoring highlights the effectiveness of NASA's tracking systems, ensuring public safety while observing celestial phenomena.
newTitle: NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth

title: Asian Paints shares fall 3.4% to hit 52-week low after two top executives resign, check details - Upstox
summary:
Asian Paints Shares Plummet to 52-Week Low Following Executive Resignations

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Upstox

Asian Paints Ltd. experienced a significant drop in share price, reaching a 52-week low after the resignation of two top executives. The stock fell by 3.4% in early trading on December 19, marking its fourth consecutive session of decline.

  • Asian Paints' share price declined to ₹2,265.35, reflecting an 8% drop this month and over 32% in 2024.
  • Executive resignations include Shyam Swamy and Vishu Goel, effective December 17, 2024.
  • The company did not provide details regarding the reasons for the executives' resignations.
  • New appointments were announced for Ashish Rae and Gagandeep Singh Kalsi to fill management roles.
  • Recent stock declines attributed to rising competition and inflation affecting demand in the paints industry.
“The paint industry faced subdued demand during the period.” - Asian Paints

In conclusion, the challenges of increasing competition and the economic climate are exerting pressure on Asian Paints, contributing to its declining stock performance.
newTitle: Asian Paints Shares Plummet to 52-Week Low Following Executive Resignations

summary:
Impact of Spin-Bowling Decisions on R Ashwin's Retirement

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement announcement has left the cricket world in shock, stemming from his exclusion in favor of other spinners during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Ashwin was not selected for the opener at Perth, a move that likely contributed to his retirement decision.
  • Rohit Sharma's leadership return favored Ashwin's initial inclusion in the playing eleven for subsequent tests.
  • Ultimately, Ashwin’s non-selection in Brisbane prompted his early departure from the series.
  • Speculation surrounds the reasons for his sudden retirement, with hints that he had considered it for several months.

title: Dow Jones breaks 1974 record after Fed rate cut decision - Details - ET Now
summary:
Dow Jones Breaks 1974 Record After Fed Rate Cut Decision

Date: Updated Dec 19, 2024
Source: ET NOW

The US stocks finished sharply lower on Wednesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average posting its worst day in over four months after the Federal Reserve decided to lower its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 4.25-4.50% range but reduced its forecast for further rate cuts in 2025.

  • The Dow Jones lost 1,123.03 points, or 2.58%, closing at 42,326.87.
  • The Nasdaq Composite fell 716.37 points, or 3.56%, ending at 19,392.69.
  • The S&P 500 skidded 178.45 points, or 2.95%, settling at 5,872.16.
  • Deepak Jasani stated it was the worst loss for the S&P 500 on the day of a rate decision since 2001.
  • The Dow experienced its 10th consecutive decline, the longest since October 1974.
“US stocks and bonds sold off after the Federal Reserve ended its policy meeting Wednesday with a new set of economic projections that pointed to a potentially slower pace of interest-rate cuts next year than previously forecast.”

This decision by the Federal Reserve has led to significant market reactions, with stocks declining sharply and concerns growing over inflation pressures.
newTitle: Dow Jones Breaks 1974 Record After Fed Rate Cut Decision

title: 'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
summary:
'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, recognized as one of cricket's premier fast bowlers, recently surpassed Kapil Dev's record to become India's top Test wicket-taker in Australia.

  • Bumrah has overcome significant back issues to excel in cricket, achieving a record of 53 wickets in Australia.
  • He was the player of the match in India's first Test victory in Perth, claiming nine wickets in total.
  • His average of 10.90 makes him the standout bowler of the series, well ahead of his Australian counterparts.
  • Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting praised Bumrah, calling him India's greatest fast bowler across all formats.
  • Travis Head noted Bumrah's potential to be one of the greatest fast bowlers ever.
  • Despite questions regarding the legality of his bowling action, legends like Greg Chappell have defended him.
  • Bumrah's unique bowling technique has consistently troubled batters and earned admiration from players around the world.
“He is definitely India’s greatest fast bowler.” - Ricky Ponting
“Jasprit is probably going to go down as one of the greatest fast bowlers to play the game.” - Travis Head

Bumrah's remarkable achievements and comeback after injury solidify his legacy as a key player in Indian cricket history.
newTitle: 'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah

title: 7 Most beautiful and colorful Nebula images captured by NASA - India.com
summary:
7 Most Beautiful and Colorful Nebula Images Captured by NASA

Published on: December 16, 2024 | Source: India.com

This article showcases breathtaking images of various nebulae captured by NASA, highlighting their stunning colors and the scientific significance behind each image.

  • The Bubble Nebula (NGC 7635) showcases unprecedented clarity, aiding our understanding of its geometry and dynamics.
  • The Carina Nebula is an impressive feature of the Milky Way, measuring over 200 light-years in diameter.
  • The Eskimo Nebula, located 5,000 light-years away, was photographed with advanced technology in 2000.
  • MyCn18, a young planetary nebula 8,000 light-years distant, displays its unique hourglass shape due to stellar winds.
  • The Lagoon Nebula serves as a site of star formation, crucial for astronomers studying stellar evolution.
  • Orion Nebula, one of the largest images taken by the Hubble Space Telescope, covers 5% of the full Moon's visible area.
  • The Stingray Nebula, the youngest known planetary nebula, is as large as 130 solar systems.
newTitle: 7 Most Beautiful and Colorful Nebula Images Captured by NASA

5 Terrorists Killed In Encounter With Security Forces In J&K's Kulgam - NDTV
5 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Kulgam - Hindustan Times
summary:
Five Terrorists Killed in Kulgam Encounter with Security Forces

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The encounter in Kulgam district resulted in the death of five terrorists following a security operation. Two personnel were injured during the incident.

  • The gunfight began during a cordon and search operation in the Behibagh area.
  • The terrorists opened fire on security forces, leading to a retaliatory strike.
  • The operation was conducted by the Indian Army and Jammu Kashmir Police based on intelligence of terrorist presence.
“On 19 December 24, based on specific intelligence input regarding presence of terrorists, a Joint Operation launched by Indian Army & Jammu Kashmir Police at Kader, Kulgam. Suspicious activity was observed by vigilant troops and on being challenged, terrorists opened indiscriminate and heavy volume of fire. Own troops effectively retaliated.” - Chinar Corps

The encounter highlights ongoing tensions in Jammu and Kashmir, amidst a series of security operations against terrorist activities.
newTitle: Five Terrorists Killed in Kulgam Encounter with Security Forces

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs OnePlus 13: Price In India, Launch Date, Camera Upgrades, Specifications, Everythi - Times Now
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs OnePlus 13

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Samsung and OnePlus are set to clash in 2025 with their flagship smartphones: the Galaxy S25 Ultra and the OnePlus 13. Here’s a detailed comparison of their features and launch dates.

  • Launch Dates: OnePlus 13 launches on January 7, 2025, while the Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected at a Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, 2025.
  • Specifications: Both will feature Snapdragon 8 Elite chipsets; Galaxy S25 Ultra has a 6.9-inch display (QHD+), while OnePlus 13 has a 6.82-inch AMOLED display (2K+).
  • Battery: Galaxy S25 Ultra may have a 5,000mAh battery, while OnePlus 13 boasts a 6,000mAh battery.
  • Camera Upgrades: Galaxy S25 Ultra keeps a 200MP main camera; OnePlus 13 features a triple camera setup with three 50MP sensors.
  • Price: Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected around Rs 1,29,999, OnePlus 13 expected above Rs 64,999.

title: Who was Rubi Patricia Vergara? Wisconsin school shooting victim, 14, was ‘an avid reader, loved art’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who was Rubi Patricia Vergara? Wisconsin school shooting victim, 14, was ‘an avid reader, loved art’

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The sad story of Rubi Patricia Vergara, a 14-year-old freshman who was killed in a shooting at Abundant Life Christian School in Madison, Wisconsin, has emerged. She was remembered for her love of reading, art, and music.

  • Rubi was an avid reader and had a passion for art.
  • She participated in family worship, playing keyboard and singing.
  • Her family shared a special bond with her pets, Ginger the cat and Coco the dog.
  • Rubi was killed alongside a teacher, and six others were injured during the incident.
  • The funeral service will be held at City Church in Madison on December 21, 2024.
“This is our beautiful Rubi Vergara, our niece who was killed in Monday's school shooting...” - A family member reflecting on her tragic loss.

The tragic event highlights the ongoing concerns regarding school safety and the impact of such incidents on families and communities.
newTitle: Who was Rubi Patricia Vergara? Wisconsin school shooting victim, 14, was ‘an avid reader, loved art’

Ambedkar row: Congress's countrywide protest today seeking Amit Shah's resignation - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Protests Nationwide for Amit Shah's Resignation Over Ambedkar Remarks

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress has initiated a countrywide protest demanding the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah following his controversial remarks about BR Ambedkar made during a session of Parliament.

  • The protests are organized across state and district headquarters nationwide.
  • Amit Shah’s comments about Congress leaders and Ambedkar provoked a significant political backlash.
  • The opposition, including Congress, has collectively called for his resignation, claiming it insults Ambedkar's legacy.
  • PM Narendra Modi defended Shah, stating the Congress has a history of seeking to tarnish Ambedkar's legacy.
“If they had taken God's name so many times, they would have got a place in heaven.” - Amit Shah

The protests reflect deep-rooted tensions between the opposition and ruling party, centering on the respect for Ambedkar's contributions to Indian democracy.
newTitle: Congress Protests Nationwide for Amit Shah's Resignation Over Ambedkar Remarks

title: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma Contradict On Ashwin's Retirement Plan, Confusion Erupts - NDTV Sports
summary:
Kohli and Rohit Dispute Details of Ashwin's Sudden Retirement Announcement

Published on: 18 December 2024 | Source: NDTV

Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket during the ongoing India vs Australia series, leading to confusion over when he made the decision. Kohli and Rohit gave differing accounts, leaving supporters wondering about Ashwin's true intentions.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement with two Tests remaining in the series.
  • Kohli claimed he learned about the retirement on the same day Ashwin announced it.
  • Rohit stated he was aware of Ashwin’s retirement thoughts beforehand.
  • Different reports suggest Ashwin had been contemplating retirement since earlier in the series.
“I’ve played with you for 14 years and when you told me today you're retiring, it made me a bit emotional,” - Virat Kohli.

It remains unclear when exactly Ashwin decided to retire, with various reports complicating the narrative.
newTitle: Kohli and Rohit Dispute Details of Ashwin's Sudden Retirement Announcement

title: Elon Musk's alleged drug abuse will barr him from entering certain SpaceX buildings: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Elon Musk's Alleged Drug Use Affects Security Clearance at SpaceX

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Elon Musk's executives have advised him against applying for higher security clearances due to concerns related to drug use allegations and foreign connections, which could lead to his current clearance being revoked.

  • Musk’s security clearance status is currently “top secret,” allowing partial access to government-related projects.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding Musk’s lifestyle and substance use, particularly connections with foreign figures like Vladimir Putin.
  • SpaceX has denied allegations regarding Musk’s connections to Putin and any substance use.
  • Musk’s clearance allows access to certain Department of Defense facilities, but restricts him from viewing sensitive information.

“Most of the stuff that I’m aware of...the reason to keep it top secret is it’s so boring.” - Elon Musk

The implications of these allegations could impact Musk’s access to crucial security information and potential government projects.
newTitle: Elon Musk's Alleged Drug Use Affects Security Clearance at SpaceX

title: J&K: 'Mystery' illness grips Rajouri village, toll at 8 as Govt calls in experts - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mystery Illness Claims 8 Lives in Rajouri Village, J&K Government Calls in Experts

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A mysterious illness has struck Badhaal village in Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in eight fatalities, mostly children. Authorities have deployed a central team of experts and a mobile laboratory to investigate the cause of the illness.

  • The death toll has risen to eight, with victims primarily from two families in Badhaal village.
  • A mobile laboratory (BSL-3) has been sent to expedite testing of the illness.
  • The latest victim was a 12-year-old boy who succumbed after being hospitalized for six days.
  • Past cases include the deaths of two of his younger siblings.
"In response to the incident, a Biosafety Level 3 (BSL-3) mobile laboratory has been sent to Rajouri," said a government spokesperson.

This incident highlights the urgency of identifying the illness to prevent further cases, ensuring community safety and health.
newTitle: Mystery Illness Claims 8 Lives in Rajouri Village, J&K Government Calls in Experts
